title: Building Trust
summary: Foster vulnerability-based trust among team members to create a safe environment for open communication.

details.content: Without trust, team members are unwilling to be vulnerable, admit mistakes, or ask for help, which undermines collaboration and problem-solving.
A team member openly shares a recent mistake in a meeting, prompting others to offer support and solutions rather than criticism.

content: Encourage team members to share personal stories or challenges.
Model vulnerability by admitting your own mistakes as a leader.
Create regular opportunities for team-building activities.
Acknowledge and appreciate honesty and openness.

title: Mastering Conflict
summary: Promote healthy debate and constructive conflict to surface the best ideas and resolve issues quickly.

details.content: Avoiding conflict leads to artificial harmony and unresolved issues, while productive conflict encourages innovation and clarity.
During a project discussion, team members respectfully challenge each other's ideas, leading to a stronger final plan.

content: Set ground rules for respectful disagreement.
Encourage all voices to be heard, especially quieter members.
Address issues directly rather than letting them fester.
Debrief after conflicts to reinforce positive behaviors.

title: Achieving Commitment
summary: Ensure all team members are clear on decisions and committed to agreed-upon actions, even if there is initial disagreement.

details.content: Lack of commitment leads to ambiguity and inconsistent follow-through, while clarity and buy-in drive coordinated action.
After a heated discussion, the team agrees on a course of action and each member publicly states their commitment to the plan.

content: Summarize decisions at the end of meetings.
Ask each member to voice their understanding and commitment.
Clarify roles and responsibilities for follow-up.
Encourage questions to address lingering doubts.

title: Embracing Accountability
summary: Hold yourself and others accountable for delivering on commitments and upholding team standards.

details.content: Without accountability, mediocrity and missed deadlines become acceptable, undermining team performance and trust.
A team member reminds a colleague about a missed deadline in a supportive way, prompting corrective action.

content: Set clear expectations and deadlines.
Regularly review progress as a team.
Encourage peer-to-peer feedback.
Address missed commitments promptly and constructively.

title: Focusing on Results
summary: Keep the team focused on collective outcomes rather than individual goals or departmental interests.

details.content: When team members prioritize personal success over team results, overall performance suffers and goals are missed.
The team celebrates achieving a shared sales target, recognizing contributions from all members rather than just top performers.

content: Define clear, measurable team goals.
Track progress publicly and regularly.
Reward team achievements over individual accomplishments.
Remind the team of the bigger picture and shared purpose.
